intro: Psychotria cathetoneura, commonly known as the narrow-veined psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with prominent venation patterns. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in the wild.
